title: Requires school health service aides in New York city public schools
summary: Requires that each elementary and secondary public school in the city of New York be staffed by at least one full-time school health service aide.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2074

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education  law,  in  relation  to  requiring  school
         health service aides in schools within a city with a population of one
         million or more

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 902 of the education law is amended by adding a new
    2  subdivision 4 to read as follows:
    3    4. IN CITIES WITH A POPULATION OF ONE MILLION OR MORE,  AT  LEAST  ONE
    4  FULL-TIME  SCHOOL  HEALTH  SERVICE AIDE SHALL BE EMPLOYED IN EACH PUBLIC
    5  ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL.
    6    S 2. This act shall  take  effect  on  the  first  of  September  next
    7  succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06511-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to requiring school health service aides in schools within a city with a population of one million or more
